website_summaries.verdict: With a luxuriously soft texture and an all natural bamboo construction, these liners are as good for the planet as they are for delicate skin.
pros: They’re softer and thicker than most, delivering superior comfort for tiny tushies
Fluids pass through easily while solid waste stays on top
Free of harsh chemicals, chlorine, and fragrance
Biodegradable and compostable in as little as 20 to 45 days
Generous size can be cut in half or folded around diaper edges
cons: Can stick to skin when soaked

customer_reviews.title: Almost worth it
customer_reviews.text: I like that we can use these to keep the inside of our cloth diapers clean but wish they worked better. Because they're inside the somewhat bulky diaper, they move a lot and when my daughter pooped, it was stuck in this and that made it disgusting to clean. I'd rather just toss what I can in the toilet and toss the liner in the liner laundry bag everytime. Maybe if they were longer, we could tuck the back into the pocket of the diaper and it may help it stay in a good place
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Williams

customer_reviews.title: Softer than other brands
customer_reviews.text: This was the first brand diaper liner I bought. I love them. Used the whole roll. Someone else recommended Grovia bioliners. They're the same price for twice as many. I bought them, but they are so rough compared to these!! I only used 2 of the others before ordering another roll of the Wegreeco. Soooo soft on baby's bum. I'll either save the others for when he's a toddler or give them to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: StarDust

customer_reviews.title: Great but not flushable
customer_reviews.text: NO LINERS ARE FLUSHABLE! If it's flushable, it has to break down in water, if it breaks down in water then it would break down under baby's butt. I hate that companies advertise these things as flushable. That being said, I went into it knowing they weren't flushable so they work well for the purpose. I tip solids into toilet and throw into trash. Just saves me the hassle of having to rinse the diapers. I pretty much know my kids poop schedule so only use a liner once a day. They do remain a bit wet from pee though which isn't ideal but we haven't really had issues with rashes or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Easier
customer_reviews.text: This definitely makes cloth diapers easier. I read a bunch of reviews before buying this so I would like to point out this is strictly to "catch" the poo, not add in absorbance. I've noticed it does move around in the diapers when you have an active baby but not so much so that it doesn't still work. I wouldn't recommend flushing it though, in all honestly if you throw out dirty diapers already you know what the expected smell is going to be. I haven't noticed it being more noticable (and I'm 8 months pregnant lol).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Skip these; stick with GroVia!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since my normal go-to liners (GroVia) were out of stock. Big mistake. These are much thicker and more cloth-like which makes them slide around between my baby's bottom and the cloth diaper. They bunch up horribly when wet, so if the diaper was wet before it was soiled, the liner will very likely be useless in containing the solids. They're also slightly smaller than GroVia's which is clearly a downside, especially for toddler diapering. I don't like these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany R. Mountz

customer_reviews.title: If you cloth diaper you NEED these in your life!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than the gro via liners I used to use! These are so soft to the touch and still keep my babe protected from diaper rash. They which moisture away perfectly and even keep # 2’s contained and I breastfeed so hers are almost liquid and these still work! I don’t even need to rinse diapers off!! I can’t recommend highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use under each breast due to excessive sweating... they are very soft and keep my skin dry and free from skin rashes due to sweating. plus I didn't have to change my bra at all yesterday like I usually do a few times a day. the only downside you will have to adjust them every now and then due to slipping but that's normal. very happy that I went with these over the washable under bra pads they sell out there. even tho they are for diaper use I will buy these again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work as intended
customer_reviews.text: My only pro for these is they are soft. I bought these to try and sadly if she pees before going poop (which happens 90% of the time) they just absorb the pee, bunch up, and then stick to her. Sadly this means they don’t catch the poop they are intended for, and then keep her wet instead of letting the liquid pass through them to let the diaper absorb it and keep her dry. I will be sticking with the original liners I was using which aren’t as soft but they don’t absorb liquid and only catch the solid waste. Skip these.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Young

customer_reviews.title: Great price, disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love How soft this material is! The major downfall is that the urine sits in the liner because of the bamboo material. So when you remove it, it feels like a wet wipe, literally. So baby’s bottom is still wet. She got a rash from this because it was wet on her bottom.
customer_reviews.author: shanequia cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great size and texture
customer_reviews.text: These liners worked really well with our cloth diapers. They are a little wider than other ones, so we had to tuck in the sides, but that also meant less clean up afterwards. The texture of these liners is really soft, so no complaints from my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCune

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diaper clean up.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and have been using these liners for my the cloth diapers for my twin girls. They are soft on my babies skin. I use AIO cloth diapers, and these add a thin layer to block poop solids from gettin on the diaper. I particularly like them if my babies poop in their diapers since it helps me with the cleaning process. Some of the poop gets through but the liners allow me to easily toss the solid matter for easier clean up. These are not meant to absorb urine. I will definitely continue to use these liners. There are other brands that are cheaper, but I haven’t tried those yet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: These are a lifesaver. we have been cloth diapering for nine years, (we have four kids)and these have made it so much easier. There is so much less gross clean up and dealing with poop. When there’s a poop in it we can just drop it in the toilet, otherwise we just toss it in the trash and there is immensely less clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: These chafe soft skin badly.
customer_reviews.text: You don’t want absorbency in a diaper line, you want the pee to go through and the poo to stay. This liner doesn’t do this, it keeps pee close to the skin instead of filtering through to the washable liner. MORE IMPORTANTLY- This liner is a rougher, more abrasive texture than other liners I’ve bought. My son rode his bike as per the usual every day routine and the first time he had this liner on he chafed enough to bleed. Not cool, not stoked, don’t recommend at all unless you’ve got an elephant skinned baby.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Wolsey

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite - not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Soft? Yes. Sturdy? No. They fall apart when containing/discarding solids and shaking off solids is terrible the fabric just stretches (we don’t flush them). Bought because my usual liners were out of stock and can’t wait for them to be back. Added - I’m finding fibers of the liners all over my baby’s diaper area. I have to peel them off a squirmy baby and still find them hidden during bath time.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Work Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I know some of the reviews say these are no good but I’ve had a wonderful experience with these liners! Unlike some others said these do stay in place just fine and don’t bunch. They get all the solids making it so nice And easy to just grab and flush. I only flush the solids and throw the wet ones in the trash as to not clog the toilet and haven’t had any issues with doing so. No rashes for my little one. I would highly recommend these to anyone cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: Jenise

customer_reviews.title: Very soft and wonderful product for baby's bottom!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about these diaper liners. The urine goes straight through and it catches most/all of the poop, making it SO much easier to clean our cloth diapers. The are soft and a little scratchy so you can place it where it's needed on your baby's bottom. The product description says it's flushable, however I have not tried flushing them due to having a septic system and being paranoid about a possible clog-up. I have been using them for two months and plan to keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Groshek

customer_reviews.title: Helps make cloth diaper changes cleaner, easier & are better quality than Bumkins!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 daughters but have only used this with our youngest! We have been cloth diapering for 3 months now & after doing research, I learned how to keep soiled diaper mess at a bare minimum & these liners help tremendously!!! They’re strong yet soft & flushable (although it somehow has clogged one of our toilets but not the other). These are also thicker & come in a roll, as opposed to the Bumkins liners that come folded in a box & are much thinner.... Love, love love!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Munguia

customer_reviews.title: Lines well
customer_reviews.text: I tried these out bc they were a bit cheaper then our usual. They work fine, but I prefer the others we usually buy because the waybtheyre made they stretch side ways instead of long ways. To me it makes more sense to stretch long ways because the length of each tushy isnt the same. I like to stretch the other the length of the diaper to cover all of it. The width seems fine, they all bunch anyways but. All in all it fits the purpose. To be able to flush poo
customer_reviews.author: Jamee

customer_reviews.title: WEGREECO 100% BAMBOO DIAPER LINERS, ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY, EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: My daughter decided to use reusable diapers with her baby girl Sara; Wegreeco bamboo diaper liners have proven excellent, environmentally friendly, easy to use and have made it easy to use the reusable diapers. I am in charge of caring for Sara as my daughter has a tight schedule and I feared washing the diapers would take too much time, but the liners have made things easy. Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fernanda Ribadeneira

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These are a must with cloth diapers! It may seem silly at first, but having this layer in there makes cleaning up the poop SOOO much easier even with newborn poops that aren’t exactly solid. If we didn’t have these I don’t know that we would have stuck with using cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Caused terrible diaper rash!
customer_reviews.text: I added these to my son's diaper routine, did not change anything else and he developed the worst diaper rash I've seen despite diaper changes every two hours. It looked like a chemical burn and it took weeks to heal the two thumb sized wounds on his bottom. Even now almost 4 weeks later he has scars. I absolutely do NOT recommend this product. Aside from that, as others have mentioned they stick to the genitals like velcro and you have to be very delicate when removing them
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Easy as can be
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with cloth diapers. Especially when your treating diaper rash. From introducing new food keeps a lot of the poop of the diaper for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Mostly useless
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty useless in my opinion. They don’t stay in place and they don’t really absorb anything so they were just one more messy thing to clean up when doing diaper laundry. They’re really soft but didn’t serve their purpose at all. Not sure what to do with the rest of the roll!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel in OR

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and love this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 1 month old son for his cloth diapers. I have to say I’m very satisfied with how easy it makes for cleaning the diaper. All you have to do is after the baby makes a poo is throw in the toilet and rinse diaper ! No more having poo in the diaper with this liner it’s super soft against baby’s sensitive area and super absorbent! Very pleased ! Thank you for this womder Product and great customer service !
customer_reviews.author: Productreviewmom

customer_reviews.title: So soft
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite liners! They’re soooo soft and stretchy and they wrap around prefolds so well! Definitely have flushed and thrown these when soiled too.
customer_reviews.author: Dana R. Mollet

customer_reviews.title: Super soft!
customer_reviews.text: These liners are really nice. I do have to custom fold them to fit the cloth diaper but they do their job really well and contain the mess. They are very soft and for the most part stay put on my 9 month old who is an active crawler. I will definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: If your'e on the fence on cloth,  buy these!!
customer_reviews.text: Omgggggggg this makes cloth diapering so so soooooo much easier. Little to no transfer of poop to the diaper it's self, if there is transfer it's minimal coloring never solid waste. Flushable, I started using flushable wipes and it had made the cloth diaper experience so much different
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: But we have never had a clog issue with them like we had with other liners
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I opened these up because they looked very thick and didn't dissolve or clump well when I did a water soak test before using. But we have never had a clog issue with them like we had with other liners. They are bamboo and so much softer to the touch than other brands as well. They catch the poo and let liquid through. I thought I had made a bad purchase at first, but after using almost the entire roll, I will be buying these again soon.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: So soft and do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to cloth diapering and these have helped make it a breeze so far. They catch all of my 9-month-old's solids and are silky soft. I'm grateful I found these in my research of products. I do not flush them, due to not knowing how old our rental's waste system is, but instead drop them into the Diaper Genie I used when we were using disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Usually awesome
customer_reviews.text: These make changing poopy diapers SO great! No more spraying- most of the time. Rated 3 stars because they bunch up frequently and in maybe 1 out of every 6 diapers, the liner doesnt catch the poop :( But when they work, they work great
customer_reviews.author: Carine Family

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These were terrible in my opinion. They kept bunching up inside her diaper, the poop went through anyways and the liner keeps her wet instead of letting the cloth diaper do it's job of wicking moisture. Returned. Getting a sprayer instead and just dealing with the mess, had to deal with it anyways even though I used these liners....
customer_reviews.author: Makenzie

customer_reviews.title: They are soft but bunch.
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are soft. I like the price. I will not buy again however because they bunch and move around missing the bm and are wet when I remove them from diaper. Which means pee is next to his skin for a period of time. The brand i used before was always dry meaning the pee was wicked away from his skin and into the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: sher

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey
customer_reviews.text: Good product, soft. A little pricey. My lvs diapers are in similar price. These are about $0.1 each, and lvs diaper is about $0.15 each. Not really saving money. I decided to use reusable handmade microfleece as a substitute.
customer_reviews.author: yuan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my child reusable diapers ! So easy to keep clean . I live in an apartment so it’s hard to bleach them with sunlight . This keeps them from sever staining .
customer_reviews.author: Crazygirlgamr

customer_reviews.title: No good. Maybe not for active baby
customer_reviews.text: You get a huge roll for what you spend. At first feel these are awesome. Why the low review? Well the material falls completely apart with just Normal play. I checked many diapers that were dry, however the liner had fallen apart. Wet diapers I had to pick material out of booty crack. And poop cleanup... there was no point to the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Skippershoney

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful to have!
customer_reviews.text: I love having these liners because it makes clean up with the cloth diapers so much easier! They’re very soft and safe to our against baby’s sensitive skin. Definitely worth getting if you’re cloth diapering.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: These were such a waste of money. They bunch up in the diaper so bad that using them is absolutely useless! Don't waste your money. I would rather just deal with spraying out the diaper, which I still have to do while using these.
customer_reviews.author: M&CMommy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but. . .
customer_reviews.text: These are great for what they are made for. My only problem was that they kind of pill apart and pieces stick to my kids skin.
customer_reviews.author: Bre A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product- soft on baby
customer_reviews.text: Got these as a first time cloth diapering. Love them! I actually tore in half for my newborn size bc the liners were big enough to do that ;)
customer_reviews.author: Tialyn White

customer_reviews.title: Love them, very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Makes messy cloth diapers manageable. Just line the diaper with one, very soft on the baby bum. Then when changing the diaper, just take out the liner and throw in the diaper trash. Messy diapers are no longer a nightmare!
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely loved the diaper liners. We cud save so much effort by not having to deal with cleaning the stains on the cloth diapers so much. The best part was it would stay in place so much better than other liners in the market and not shrink after they got wet. We certainly loved the product.
customer_reviews.author: AksN

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the poo particles off the cloth diaper.
customer_reviews.text: These are inserts that you put between your kid’s bum and the cloth diaper. They are soft and make it so the doody doesn’t stick to the absorbent part of cloth diaper. These do their job adequately. I have ordered and reordered them, so clearly they work.
customer_reviews.author: Cersei L.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I gave it a try!
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on these when the brand I usually use ran out. Really glad I did! They are so much softer and still work as well. The packaging is smaller and doesn't have a tube in the center which means less waste.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Look

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I can't speak about the use in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I can't speak about the use in a diaper, but I use them under my bra as a liner to catch perspiration and they work like magic! The best part is that they are disposable. It wicks the moisture away really nicely and I recommend it over the fabric bra liners that just don't stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Katylady

customer_reviews.title: They peel off easily too. 1 issue we had
customer_reviews.text: These work well, are soft on my baby's skin, and cover a large portion of the diaper to ensure very little escapes. They peel off easily too. 1 issue we had, though, was that they occasionally stick to baby's skin. Peeling them off seems to irritate the skin a bit. Otherwise, these are a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cleaning and disposing
customer_reviews.text: Love them I use in reusable diapers and it prevents baby’s poop from going through and easier to lifer and depose off instead having additional mess from cloth diaper
customer_reviews.author: XVargas

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful with cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: They work well to make cleanup easier. They do let a little staining through but with cold wash stains come out. They do not irritate my daughter's skin.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon Dubinsky

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine. They do however leave a bit of fabric strands (I don't think that's the correct way to describe that) behind on baby so I make sure to cut the pieces to fit properly in the diaper and clean baby really well during changes.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place with an active little one!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for lining cloth diapers. We usually use a different brand and those slip around in the diaper and sometimes does not catch everything. These stay in place, even with an active little one, and catch everything. We usually throw away the ones that do not have #2 on it so as not to add more down the plumbing than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use it:
customer_reviews.text: I wish we liked these. Incredibly soft compared to other liners. These gave my daughter a rash, though. Will not be using these again. Update: I’m bumping it up another star for the impeccable customer service. They offered me to try another product or give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jei

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Saw great reviews, but this is not one of those. These stick to my sons balls and penis, making the poopy diapers more of a mess. Pretty inconvenient considering I had just changed him 5 minutes prior and with that poppy diaper it was rough. Went all over when these are supposed to make an easy cleanup. These aren’t flushable, we just had our house build last year and we are on city water. So the reason these clogged our toilet I don’t know. Very disappointed will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Pehling

customer_reviews.title: Do a great job
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why they have you read absorbency, as the point is if they aren’t absorbent. They are supposed to filter the solids and let the liquid through which they do a great job of. We were very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: John D Davidhizar Jr

customer_reviews.title: Soft and durable
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these liners. They are strong enough and big enough that they catch all the poop yet they are super soft. These are the only liners we will use until potty training!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brazelton

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth diaper liner
customer_reviews.text: These work great in my cloth diapers. My husband was afraid of dealing with the BM so these help make clean up a breeze. I haven't flushed them but I bought them more for creating a liner for easier clean up. Will definitely reorder more when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Queen sweetie

customer_reviews.title: THESE CHANGED AND ARE HORRIBLE AND SCRATCHY NOW
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product, this new pack is horrible, stiff, crunchy and no longer soft. I will never buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Healing Cave Lady

customer_reviews.title: Easy of cleaning of diaper
customer_reviews.text: Very nice liner. Easy to use. I stack the diapers for the day with a liner on each. Just dropping soiled liner in the trash after changing. No rinsing diaper.
customer_reviews.author: biking lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these several times now and I really like them. They are a tad bit wide but I've found if you fold it over just a little they fit great in a cloth diaper. Sure makes cleaning toddler poo much easier. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, soft, and very effective
customer_reviews.text: These are AMAZING. Super soft, and just a little bit of stretch. They give us the necessary amount of coverage to skip the diaper sprayer (or scraping...). We tried GroVia ones first and they were fine but didn’t work nearly so well as these.
customer_reviews.author: RAR

customer_reviews.title: Very Soft
customer_reviews.text: This is a great extra barrier, It isnt very absorbent, but helps keep the skin away from the wet diaper. Helps with Rashes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Holds liquid
customer_reviews.text: These are so soft but they are holding in liquid and my 8m old started getting diaper rashes. I wanted them to hold just poop and the liquid to go through like the different brand I ran out of.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Mothra

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product because it is softer on my little one versus another brand. The only con is that is sheds a little on his button but nothing that couldn't be cleaned when whipping. Overall, I would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: PorscheNikki

customer_reviews.title: Great for meconium when using cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: We used these for the first two weeks and they are great at catching the meconium from the cloth diapers that we used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best quality liners we have tried
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several kinds of liners. These are the softest and most durable I've tried. We love them! Also, rarely does a poop stain even come through they are thicker than most brands too. And they stick to diaper good! Five stars to us and save lots of laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: Soft & Strong
customer_reviews.text: These liners are super soft, strong (so they don't dissolve before you can change diaper!), and a generous size. They keep my baby's cloth diapers from getting stained because they catch and absorb so much. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Pedregosa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Catches what it’s supposed to and leaves cloth diapers ready for washing!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra P.

customer_reviews.title: Soft,Thick liner and easy to dispose of
customer_reviews.text: I loved how they felt nice and thick and really help with diaper rash creams and clean up!! And they are thick but with water they come apart well and flush super easy!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Nieto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand
customer_reviews.text: It was not what I thought. They were a bit rough. They bunch up and don’t stay in place. Wouldn’t recommend. I am not using them anymore. I gave up on them. I used about maybe 8 sheets and they didn’t work
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to dispose of ENG baby poo
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the length of the porduct. Could have made shorter so that more can be on a roll. But that can be corrected by cutting. Used in cloth diapers when we are out and about, also when baby had a small rash coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnna

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: This is not helpful at all. It is better to use a very thin burb cloth than this. It gives my kids a very bad rashes.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Not one negative thing
customer_reviews.text: These liners are thick and trap the waste reliably. They generous sizing means you aren’t getting waste overflow into the diapers that you’re trying to protect. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Allen

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They are awesome cause it’s much easier to clean my cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Betancourt

customer_reviews.title: makes environmental diapers easier
customer_reviews.text: I used these when my kids were babies they are now in their 30's. Place these in a cotton washable diaper and when the baby poops, flush this liner with the poop. No need to rinse the diapers in the toilet, just throw them into the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use when outside of the house, and it works great! Exactly as described, and just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Kay

customer_reviews.title: Best liners I've used. Exclusive cloth diaper wearer.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, they are wide to cover all or the cloth diaper. Some liners leave a sort of white fiber that stick to the skin like fine cotton fibers around the genital area but this type never did that.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great value and soft
customer_reviews.text: We have tried similar products and this is by far my favorite. They are super soft and only one is needed. I only gave 4 star for absorbancy as this is not their main purpose. We add these to the bamboo liners just for ease of clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi S

customer_reviews.title: Nothing compares
customer_reviews.text: We've used these for months tried another option that was a tiny bit cheaper but was NOT worth it. These are amazing and ill never cheat on them again.
customer_reviews.author: gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Soft but does not wick away moisture
customer_reviews.text: These are very absorbent and soft but they do not wick away moisture from baby butt. These are wet on every diaper change compared to other brand that is always dry. I will use what I have but not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft and better environmentally. Good price too.
customer_reviews.text: I love these more than other brands I’ve tried. Others have been not very soft on my babies sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Cher/Cheryl Sever

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Runs through fast. Not very absorbant unless you use quite a few like 6 plus
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Works well and great service!
customer_reviews.text: This holds up well to a lot of liquid and holds in solids, making it a lot easier to use cloth diapers now that my little one is eating real food. I throw them away, but I actually think they would flush easily. The only drawback is that I wish it was longer to cover the entire length of the diaper. I gave feedback to the seller (who sought out feedback right after I received them) and they are working with their manufacturer to do so! You can't beat responsiveness from companies.
customer_reviews.author: EcoFriendlyDetroit

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper liners!
customer_reviews.text: I put these liner in my baby’s cloth diapers when we leave the house so I don’t have to deal with a messy poopy diaper on the go. They catch all the poo, don’t irritate my baby’s sensitive skin and the are very sturdy. I will be purchasing again soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica N. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like them
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be great but every time I use them they just end up in a ball in her diaper. They don’t stay put so they serve no purpose for us.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Helps with poop on cloth diaper
customer_reviews.text: Really helps keep the poop off the cloth diaper. Poop color still comes through, but it's much less. Down side is it sticks like seran wrap to my baby when its wet. My baby doesnt like them.
customer_reviews.author: Razzie

customer_reviews.title: Less Absorbency than expected
customer_reviews.text: Not very impressed. Way to thin & the not thick enough to hold contents in diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for not wanting to deal with poop and also really good to protect the diaper with rash cream
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lynn Edwards

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to love?
customer_reviews.text: Disposable liner, whats not to love? Easy poop clean up, avoid creams touching your nappies and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: the baphomet

customer_reviews.title: NOT FLUSHABLE.
customer_reviews.text: Great except these ARE NOT FLUSHABLE. They say they are but, very clearly print on the side that they cause septic blockage and these are in no way thin. They are not water soluble.
customer_reviews.author: Delaynie Meade

customer_reviews.title: No leak thru
customer_reviews.text: For the price paid on these it is well worth it. I usually use them in combination with the charcoal diaper and use 2 squares and in most cases even with poop, once I left the liners up the cloth diaper has no remainings tha have snuck through this are great.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Great liners!
customer_reviews.text: These are great liners, soft and keep the diaper itself clean, except for stain that comes off during wash. We don’t throw them into the toilet so I’m not sure how good they work with septic system.
customer_reviews.author: Krisgiraffik

customer_reviews.title: No rinsing diapers anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Good size and they make cloth diapering SO easy! No rinsing necessary. I do not put them in the septic tho.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cloth diapers!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are so convenient for cloth diapering. I use them around the time of day my son poops. Easier to clean poop diapers
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: These def do the Job, just make sure to change the baby often, the material gets furry and stuck to the babies bottom if on to long
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Iris

customer_reviews.title: Holds to much moisture.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this product at all. I feel like it holds to much moisture which could lead to diaper rash
customer_reviews.author: Lynicia Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Bunches up
customer_reviews.text: I hate this product. It's wider than the diaper, but it still bunches up and poop still goes in the diaper instead of on the liner. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: From a referral of an associate I purchased these hoping ...
customer_reviews.text: From a referral of an associate I purchased these hoping it would reduce the amount of poop on my baby's diaper. First, I notice you have to double them up to get them to work.Using just 1 strip isn't enough. When I use 1 strop it crumples and sticks to my baby. Therefore, I have to peel this wipe and the poop off of her. Prior to purchasing I read the reviews and it seems they're not flush-able. I haven't tried so I can't speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Dow Brown

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you cloth diaper!
customer_reviews.text: These work fantastic, Ive cloth diapered both my kids and it is sort of a pain to hose the diapers off, but putting these liners in makes the clean-up process so much easier and faster, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey S.

customer_reviews.title: Planning to purchase again
customer_reviews.text: These are really soft and have held solids very well. They’re not as stiff as other brands I’ve used. Fit perfectly in the side pocket of our diaper bag (after using a few first).
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest liners
customer_reviews.text: These liners soak up the urine and hold it on my babies skin. She ended up with diaper rash within a day of using these. I will be going back to using the Grovia liners.
customer_reviews.author: cay

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use these with cloth diapers, these liners enable me to keep his diaper clean. For any poop I just gather the ends and throw it the liner out. Also, if he has to have cream it protects the cloth diaper. I have also used them with disposable diapers if he has been pooping a lot, it helps keep the cost down.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa McGowan

customer_reviews.title: One Time Use
customer_reviews.text: Great for one time use. Can't be washed to use again, which others we have used could be. still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Langebm

product_meta.title: Wegreeco 100% Bamboo Unscented Biodegradable Diaper Liners,Fragance Free and Chlorine Free - 100 Sheets Per Roll (1 Roll, Bamboo)
feature_bullets: Wegreeco bamboo unscented biodegradable nappy liners is made from 100% bamboo viscose. Soft & Comfortable for baby bottom.Those bamboo Unscented liners are Biodegradable. Every parent deserve this!

Disposable Cloth Diaper Liners are easy to tear off and simply place liner between baby's bottom and diaper. Parents just simply takes these liners off and throw into the trash without any further step to clean the mess.
Wegreeco Bio Liners help parents less laundry time. No more soaking stained diapers and extending the life of the diapers!
Recommend throw the used diaper liner into the trash,No flush in case toilet blocking

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars832 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
